VOICES OP EUROPE
NO. 63
Duration: 29* 20l?
Dr, Herbert Tingsten and Monsieur Claude Petit
On life in Sweden and a small French village
Background: in Stockholm Milton Mayer interviews Dr. Herbert
Tingsten, chief editor of Dagens Nyheter, the daily news of
Stockholm, the largest newspaper in Scandinavia. The French
village of Les Hermites, the Hermits, is about 125 miles south
of Paris, not far from the city of Tour. It is an ancient
village of 300 persons with ~a total population including the
farm community roundabout of about 800, The mayor of Les Hermites
is Monsieur Claude Petit who was born in 1909, the son of the
village notary. One of his grandfathers was a peasant and
another a wagon maker. By virtue partly of his high scholastic
standing and partly because of his fathers financial ability,
Claude Petit was able to go to the university, which meant Paris.
After leaving the university he entered the French Civil Service
in the Department of Labor, He was with the English Army at
Dunkirk and in 1944 was elected mayor of Les Hermites.
